body_content.explanation: one of a particular type of carboxylic acids (= acids containing carbon as part of a group of atoms —COOH) that are important in the diet, for energy, and for building the body's cells :
examples: Many types of fish and seafood contain omega-3 fatty acids that are essential during pregnancy.
Meat provided a concentrated source of protein, vitamins, minerals and fatty acids that helped our human ancestors grow taller.
